title: Optimal Data-Dependent Hashing for Approximate Near Neighbors.
abstract: We show an optimal data-dependent hashing scheme for the approximate near neighbor problem. For an n-point dataset in a d-dimensional space our data structure achieves query time O(d ⋅ n ρ+o(1) ) and space O(n 1+ρ+o(1)  + d ⋅ n), where ρ=1/(2c 2 -1) for the Euclidean space and approximation c>1. For the Hamming space, we obtain an exponent of ρ=1/(2c-1). Our result completes the direction set forth in (Andoni, Indyk, Nguyen, Razenshteyn 2014) who gave a proof-of-concept that data-dependent hashing can outperform classic Locality Sensitive Hashing (LSH). In contrast to (Andoni, Indyk, Nguyen, Razenshteyn 2014), the new bound is not only optimal, but in fact improves over the best (optimal) LSH data structures (Indyk, Motwani 1998) (Andoni, Indyk 2006) for all approximation factors c>1.   From the technical perspective, we proceed by decomposing an  arbitrary  dataset into several subsets that are, in a certain sense, pseudo-random.
